data.title: U.S. Senate Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry - Republican
data.meta_description: U.S. Senate Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry - Republican | 2,015 followers on LinkedIn. Looking out for America's farmers and ranchers since 1825 | Since its creation, the Senate Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry has helped establish, guide, and examine agricultural policies here and abroad.  It has had a hand in fashioning the research and teaching of the 1860â€™s, the price and income support controls of the 1930â€™s, and the international trade of the 1990â€™s.  The Committee has been active in times of prosperity and peace, as well as in times of depression and war.

The Senate Republican Farm Bill Framework was based on feedback gathered from the listening sessions Ranking Member John Boozman and his colleagues held in over 20 different states with diverse agriculture profiles. These visits have given senators the opportunity to hear directly from farmers, from distinctly different parts of the country, about what they need included in the farm bill. Because as Ranking Member Boozman often stresses, â€œThe answers to our problems need to come from the ground up.â€ The needs & concerns of farm country are reflected throughout our framework.

American Farm Bureau Federationâ€™s Council of Presidents met in Washington this week. Ranking Member John Boozman stopped by this morning to talk about why we need more farm in the farm bill and to take their questions on where the process stands and what they need to see in the end product.
